title: The lore newspaper thingy
body:
Hello, most of us that started to play this game a few season ago or even started in beta like me remember when on launcher we had the lore thing, that told us about background story of league and all that, it used to be updated and riot was taking care of it, now it is completely gone. Why is that riot? This game lost it's story completely... now it's just a simple game where you bash qwerfd and hope that you get a kill or two.
We all remember beta, season one and two, these were good times, swain ad was a normal thing and no one would flame you for picking ashe mid, the game had a lore, something we could build up on, and now it's all lost. I understand that you want to focus on getting money from kids and you want to make LCS even bigger thing but come on, don't just dump the story of this game, some of the skins you make are just disappointing, they have nothing to do with league lore but you still release them... where is the logic in that? I demand you to give us back the story, and the good old gameplay we used to be able to have... :c

I would like to hear your opinion people, what do you think about all this?

replies.body:
Hey man!

Great to see you're interested in the Lore behind our world. A while back we released this article talking about the direction we wanted to the world and story.
http://oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/creative-spotlight/dev-blog-exploring-runeterra

Since then there have been a few pieces developing the story , I will link some below for you!

[Freljord](http://promo.leagueoflegends.com/en/freljord/)
[Shurima](http://promo.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/shurima/story/index.html)
[Xerath back story](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/story-art/RdkEIREJ-short-stories-xerathunbound)

it's great to see there is still some kind of lore but I don't understand what happened to the thingy we were able to access in launcher.. I think you should make new players acknowledge the lore that league has and make them understand that some players see something more than just e sports and bashing keyboard.

The thingy you were talking about was called the journals of justice I believe. That old lore is under retcon at the moment. I'm not on the Narrative team they had this great comment a few days ago about what they are working on.

http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/story-art/khkWEbWQ-what-the-hell-is-the-lore-team-getting-paid-for?comment=005b

Thanks... The discussion is really nice and well... all the things I could think of are mentioned there. I mean come on riot... we can't have champs just popping up from nowehere for no reason, with random op items that came out of nowehere like the ekko's time thingy. I get that you want to build up the story over time and join some of the characters together but come on... what the fuck riot, you can't just drop a champ into the league. Give me a reason why would Ekko fight in the league... why? what is his purpose? and where the fuck did he get the time shitznit from?!  Okay I read his lore and apparantely he is a clever lad that made it himself.. fair enough, But I still don't get why he is fighting in league? My best guess is that well idk.. since it is mentioned that he will do anything to protect his friends, there could be some threat from other dimension since Ekko can travel between those... but still, other dimentions? Who is his enemy? at least give us some info about it, you don't have to say who it is straight away but at least give us a hint...

Why can't you make lores like the ones you made for the old trundle.. or connections like you made between Nocturne Zed and Shen, you didn't give us all the info, but you gave us enough information to allow us to make guesses and leave it mysterious, and this is what we wanted, I think that champs appearing from nowehere for no reason is just too mysterious and dumb...

Oh yeah where the hell did the newspaper go? :c I didn't read the dev blog so sorry if my question was already answered there.

If you read the dev blog most of your points are answered there! but here is a little exerpt about why we moved away from giving every champion a reason to join the League. We moved away from connecting a characters story to the game itself because it limited the potential stories we could tell.


> In the early days of League, we created a fictional background that would justify how players could control champions during games. We came up with concepts like Summoners, Fields of Justice, an Institute of War, and indeed, the League of Legends itself – all in an attempt to provide fictional context for in-game action.
> After a while, these early choices began to create unexpected problems. Every new champion needed a reason to join and remain in the League, and as their number grew, the net result was that over time the world started to feel, well, small, and eventually less interesting. The institutions we’d designed fostered creative stagnation, limiting the ways that champions, factions and Runeterra itself could grow and change. Furthermore, the very idea of all-powerful Summoners made Champions little more than puppets manipulated by godlike powers. The background we’d created to explain in-game action was ultimately restricting the potential narrative development of the game’s defining characters.

You could go Ashe mid in the beta because it worked back then, and there wasn't anything that even remotely resembled a meta.

Ashe mid doesn't work anymore, there might be a few cases where she faces someone who she can thrash, but the majority of champions that are played in mid will utterly ruin an Ashe in a 1v1.

I had a duo premade go bot lane last night as LeBlanc and Karma, Karma refused to play like a support apart from buying a {{item:3303}} and the two friends just ended up feeding all game.
If you're on my team I expect you to go AD Marksman and Support in bottom lane, why? Because that's what the enemy team will have, and it's the most reliable choice to fight it with.

I don't want people to conform to the "current meta" just the "general meta". Ashe doesn't go mid, AD Swain never existed.

Oh trust me.. AD swain was a thing... Don't you think that it was nice to be able to choose whatever you want and try new things without getting flamed? Today even if you will pick heimer mid  you will get flamed because its not in the meta. The reason I mention the whole champs thing is because people lose the point of this game, they all get greedy for victory, it is kinda riot fault for not reminding people that this game has a back story to it and it's not just about victory...

It's a game designed purely for PvP. Riot in no way can force their player base to learn the lore and like it. As far as anyone is concerned the game is about nothing more than Winning or Losing, especially now since Riot announced they want to separate the Lore from the actual Gameplay so both can be developed independently of each other.
So when it comes down to it, LoL the GAME is only about the PvP and who wins and who loses, the lore has no consequence here.

AD Swain was never a thing, and it will remain never being a thing.
There is a difference between "choosing new things" and "playing responsibly" as long as your choice fits within the general meta, it's fine.
As I explained previously Ashe can't go mid, because 90% of the champs she'll face there will completely destroy her, I'm not talking Ashe will go 1/6. Ashe will go 0/19 by 20 minutes.

Another example is people who go double AD Marksman bottom lane, early game this works, but mid to late game both players fall off because they compete for CS, which allows the enemy ADC to get ahead of them both. In the end it looks like the double ADC players fed all game, and thus they get reported for doing that.

And let's take a look at an old in meta pick, Teemo mid.
It used to be very popular, why? Because Teemo countered a decent amount of champs that were played in middle lane.
But now?
Middle lane is typically either bursty mages or AD casters, no one that uses auto-attacks primarily, and no one that typically goes where Teemo will place his shrooms, or get within Teemo's poke range.

There is a difference between wanting to play something new, and wanting to play something that is not viable. If it doesn't fit in with the general meta (which will likely never change, the general meta is LoL, it is the way the game is played) then it more than likely wont work.

Why are do you keep on coming back to the ashe and swain thing? And idea of separating lore from gameplay is stupid imo. Im not talking about any direct impact of the lore on gameplay because that would never happen, but I just don't like the fact that the champs that are made are just "empty shells" that will probably never be filled up. And now you mention meta... ehh I think that it's just stupid and people take this game seriously, don't even look at the lore, it's like playing witcher without reading dialougs, it will become a simple game where you bash monsters... at least for me.

I keep coming back to the Swain and Ashe examples because they are the only two you've provided to be debunked.

If you're going to compare a 100% single player experience for lore against a 100% multiplayer PvP experience, then you've got no idea what you are talking about and should just stop.
They are completely different genres.
You might as well compare COD to WarZone 2100 for gameplay in that case. Or would you like me to be more obscure?

Those empty shells you talk about, have their place in the lore. They have their champion pages that contain their existence within LoL's reality. Well more to the point, Runeterra's reality, since League of Legends and Runeterra are now separate entities.
While yes a lot of champion lore needs to be rewritten, they are still who they are.

Ahh the BETA, what an awesome time. Bring back OP Rammus!

I personally wasn't interested in the lore. Too much reading for me. Maybe if they created a cinematic separate website for the lore. Or even release a TV series or a bunch of books for the lore story IDK. That's the only way id watch it.

 I'd imagine a lot of players are not big readers like me so wouldn't be too interested in it.
